alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:15PM EDT until July 29 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR HARLAN...SOUTHEASTERN LAUREL...BELL...KNOX...SOUTHERN LESLIE AND SOUTHERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 414 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Gibbs to Scalf to Bledsoe to Clover-Darby, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Harlan, Chevrolet, Barnyard, Black Snake, Pathfork and Kettle Island. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
